snippet: The clause would have prohibited the company's shareholders from filing class-action lawsuits, requiring them to use a confidential arbitration process instead.
abstract: The clause would have prohibited the company's shareholders from filing class-action lawsuits, requiring them to use a confidential arbitration process instead.
lead_paragraph: The Carlyle Group, the private equity giant that filed to go public last month, is giving in to pressure from investors and regulators over a controversial legal clause in the filing for its initial public offering.

headline.main: Carlyle Drops Arbitration Clause From I.P.O. Plans
